holidays.name: World Snake Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate, respect, and learn about snakes and their vital role in ecosystems.
holidays.origin: Established in 2009 by the Center for Snake Conservation to promote understanding and conservation of snakes.
holidays.funFact: Despite scaring many people, snakes actually help control pests and keep ecosystems balanced.

holidays.name: Corn Fritters Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the crispy, golden deliciousness of corn fritters ‚Äî a yummy fried snack made from sweet corn batter!
holidays.origin: Food lovers' day with roots in southern American and Caribbean cooking traditions.
holidays.funFact: Corn fritters were popularized during the Colonial times when corn was abundant and fried treats were a staple.

holidays.name: National Fresh Spinach Day
holidays.description: A leafy green celebration honoring the nutritional powerhouse spinach.
holidays.origin: An American food holiday to encourage healthy eating and appreciation for spinach.
holidays.funFact: Spinach has more iron per serving than many other vegetables, but the myth about it being a super-iron source started from a decimal error in the 19th century!

holidays.name: Moon Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the Apollo 11 moon landing on July 16, 1969, celebrating human space exploration.
holidays.origin: Marks the launch of the first manned mission to the moon.
holidays.funFact: Apollo 11 astronauts brought back 47.5 pounds of moon rocks, some of which are still studied by scientists today.
